alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary; Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 02 at 10:42AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID ...The Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center in Sandpoint has continued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is HIGH. * WHERE...The mountains of the Idaho Panhandle. * WHEN...In effect through 800 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...High elevation rain and warm temperatures on a previously dry snowpack continue to result in widespread areas of unstable snow. Large and very large wet slab avalanches remain likely until colder temperatures start to stabilize the snowpack. PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is notrecommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
